benchmark_details.name: V-GameGym
benchmark_details.overview: V-GameGym is a multimodal benchmark for evaluating code LLMs in visual game generation, comprising 2,219 high-quality samples sourced from 2,190 distinct repositories and organized into 100 thematic clusters.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the multimodal capabilities of code language models for game development.

data.source: 2,190 distinct Pygame repositories sourced from OpenCoder and The Stack v2.
data.annotation: Manually verified by human annotators ensuring code quality and correctness.

methodology.calculation: Scores are averaged across functionality, code quality, game logic, visual completeness, UI design, interaction logic, etc.
methodology.interpretation: Scores closer to 100 indicate better performance in code generation and game development tasks.
methodology.validation: Human validation of samples post-automated evaluation.
